result.execSummary:
The defendant Leron S Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court imposed a fine of $150.00 including costs. To be paid by 11-15-17. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered a DNA sample and imposed the surcharge

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leron S Brown

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   Court imposed a fine of $150.00, including costs.  Court ordered a DNA sample and imposed thesurcharge.  


Court ordered fine and surcharge to be paid by 11/15/17.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Defendant Leron S Brown in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Leron S Brown in custody.  Marissa Luz Burtch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  AS TO THE AMENDED INFORMATION:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
JusticePoint Pretrial STATUS UPDATE, received and filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Darryl Everett Smith did not appear in court but was informed by this clerk of violation.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties in court due to violation report from Justice Point.  Defendant was to appear at 1:30 in Br. 24 to address violation.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court did not forfeit bail at this time.

Defendant Leron S Brown in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Marissa Luz Burtch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  States offer was placed on the record and rejected by defendant.  Case remains in trial posture in Br. 24.  Justice Point violation reviewed by the court and counsels.  Discussion regarding discrepancy of how much money defendant paid justice point for retesting of samples.  Justice Point will contact the court.  The Court has referred defendant back to Justice Point for supervision.  Previous conditions to continue.  Conditions include ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY, DRUG TESTING, NO USE OR POSSESSION OF ILLEGAL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES AND NO POSSESSION OF DANGEROUS WEAPONS OR FIREARMS.  Case remains calendared in Br. 24.  mn
/Court memo from DOC stating the defendant is under supervision with the DOC.  Court has agreed to remove him from Justice Point Supervision.  Defense counsel will also contact Justice Point.  mn

Certification of MOTION transcript commencing 10/05/16 received and filed. (9 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Darryl Smith, 819 N. Sixth St. 9th Fl., Milwaukee, WI 53203.
Original FINAL PRETRIAL/MOTION HEARING/MOTION TO WITHDRAW AS COUNSEL Transcript (14 pages) commencing 01/04/17 received and filed.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report: Missed Office Contact; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: RT. Court and state are reviewing report.

Defendant Leron S Brown in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Marissa Luz Burtch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates.  Defense requests that Court remove JusticePoint supervision. Court takes no action as to request at this time. Defendant is to provide Court with documentation of supervision through DOC.  Case remains calendared in Branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 2, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 15, 2017 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Leron S Brown in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case remains calendared in Br. 24 for status.  Agreed upon request for new court date signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for March 31, 2017 at 08:30 am.
/JusticePoint report, received and filed.

Defendant Leron S Brown in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Marissa Luz Burtch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm  
Held off the record. Case in court for status conference.  Defense awaiting discovery request a status date. Case remains calendared in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for March 16, 2017 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Leron S Brown in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Marissa Luz Gurtch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Held off the record. Case set for status conference. Defense counsel request an adjournment. Case calendared in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for February 27, 2017 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received and filed. Justice Point report, dated 01/24/2017.  Deputy Court Clerk: AS.

Defendant Leron S Brown in court.  Marissa Luz Burtch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AS.  Case set for status of counsel. Defendant appears without counsel. Defendant requests more time to retain cousel. Court advises defendant to report to Public Defender's Office after todays proceedings. All parties are notified that pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 17-02 as of February 2, 2017 this case will be assigned to Judge Janet Protasiewicz, Branch 24, in Room 608 of the Courthouse. Case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for February 6, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leron S Brown in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Leron S Brown in custody.  Marissa Luz Burtch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is re-called.  Attorney Meetz informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 22.  Jury trial date of 01/17/2017 is vacated.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for January 25, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motions in Limine received and filed.
Defendant's Jury instructions received and filed.
Witness list - defendant received and filed.
Case in court for final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 22 on 01/17/2017 at 9:00am.  State rescinded their offer.

Defendant Leron S Brown in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Leron S Brown in custody.  Marissa Luz Burtch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for motion hearing.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIED the defense motion to suppress.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.

Attorney Andrew Michael Meetz in court, defendant Leron S Brown not in court, in custody.  Marissa Luz Burtch appeared for the State of Wisconsin via telephone.  Case in court for motion hearing and final pre-trial, however state is in jury trial in another branch, case adjourned.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 4, 2017 at 01:30 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 4, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Leron S Brown in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Leron S Brown in custody.  Student Intern Derek Randall under the supervision of Marissa Luz Burtch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for motion hearing.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIED the the defense motion to compel disclosure of confidential informant.  Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2017 at 09:00 am.
from Kettle Moraine.

Attorney Andrew Michael Meetz in court, defendant Leron S Brown not in court, in custody.  Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for motion hearing, however Branch 22 is in jury trial, case adjourned.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Order to Produce from Kettle Moraine.
State's Brief in Opposition to Defendant's Motion to Compel Disclosure of Confidential Informant received and filed.
Defendan't Motion to Compel Disclosure of Confidential Informant and Affidavit

Attorney Andrew Michael Meetz in court, defendant Leron S Brown not in court, in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Defense requests motion hearing date.  Jury trial date of 08/08/2016 is vacated.  Defense motions due 07/11/2016, state's reply due 08/12/2016.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Andrew Michael Meetz in court, defendant Leron S Brown not in court, in custody.  Kathering Seelow for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm  
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Andrew Michael Meetz in court via telephone, defendant Leron S Brown not in court, in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case in court for status of counsel.  Defense requests more time to review case.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22. Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.
State's Motions in Limine received and filed.
State's Jury instructions received and filed.
Witness list - plaintiff received and filed.
Demand for speedy trial withdrawn, defendant serving a revocation.

Attorney Matt Ricci in court, defendant Leron S Brown not in court, in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ricci informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Jury trial date of 05/09/2016 is vacated.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
State's Brief in Opposition to Defendant's Motion to Suppress received and filed.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Fruits of Search received and filed.  Final pre-trial and motion hearing moved from 04/22/2016 to 05/04/2016 at 1:30pm.  State response due 05/02/2016.
Speedy trial demand.

Attorney Matt Ricci in court, defendant Leron S Brown not in court, in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling, defense requests final pre-trial and SPEEDY jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Leron S Brown in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Defendant Leron S Brown in custody.  Brandon Wigley for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Continued Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #01CF636 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Exhibits are ordered withdrawn.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leron S Brown in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Defendant Leron S Brown in custody.  Daniel Murphy, student intern under the supervision of Zachary Wittchow for Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Ronald Linzmeyer-MPD Detective.  Exhibits 1 and 2 are marked offered and received into evidence.  State requests an adjournment for receipt of certified court documents.  Court ordered case adjourned for a Continued Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Leron S Brown in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Leron S Brown in custody.  Sarah Zwach appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Leron S Brown not in court.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
